required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Effects of Avanafil on Semen Parameters
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Multicenter Clinical Trial of the Effect of Avanafil (STENDRA™) on Spermatogenesis in Healthy Adult Males and Adult Males With Mild Erectile Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether avanafil will affect different aspects of sperm production.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With a Greater Than or Equal to 50% Decrease in Sperm Concentration From Baseline to Week 26
primary_outcome.description: Subjects provided 2 semen samples at each visit 2 to 12 days apart. The average value is used as the visit result.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Greater Than or Equal to 50% Reduction in Sperm Count From Baseline to Week 26
Percentage of Subjects With Greater Than or Equal to 50% Reduction in Sperm Motility From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Sperm motility was based upon the WHO grading scale: grade A, B, or C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Greater Than or Equal to 50% Reduction in Semen Volume From Baseline to Week 26
Percentage of Subjects With Greater Than or Equal to 50% Reduction in Normal Sperm Morphology From Baseline to Week 26

group.title: Avanafil
group.description: 100 mg once daily in the evening

group.title: Placebo
group.description: placebo taken once daily in the evening

group.title: Avanafil
group.description: 100 mg once daily in the evening

group.title: Placebo
group.description: placebo taken once daily in the evening

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects With a Greater Than or Equal to 50% Decrease in Sperm Concentration From Baseline to Week 26
outcome.description: Subjects provided 2 semen samples at each visit 2 to 12 days apart. The average value is used as the visit result.
outcome.population: Completer population is defined as those who completed the study through week 26 and had semen analysis at both baseline and week 26. This may differ from the definition of completers for the study flow.

group.title: Avanafil
group.description: 100 mg once daily in the evening

group.title: Placebo
group.description: placebo taken once daily in the evening

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects With a Greater Than or Equal to 50% Decrease in Sperm Concentration From Baseline to Week 26
measure.description: Subjects provided 2 semen samples at each visit 2 to 12 days apart. The average value is used as the visit result.
measure.population: Completer population is defined as those who completed the study through week 26 and had semen analysis at both baseline and week 26. This may differ from the definition of completers for the study flow.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The difference in percentage of subjects with a >/= 50% reduction from baseline to Week 26 in sperm concentration between treatment arms was analyzed using Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel method to account for the randomization stratification by baseline sperm concentration. If upper limit of 95% CI < 20% then avanafil is considered non-inferior to placebo.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence interval was only calculated for primary endpoint of the difference between avanafil and placebo, not for each individual arm.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: After Sponsor's written notification that publication of results is no longer planned or 12 months after termination of the study at all sites, Institution & PI may publish, upon written approval from Sponsor, results of the Study. Sponsor will be given the opportunity to review any proposed publication at least 60 days prior to submission for publication or disclosure. Upon Sponsor's written request, Institution and PI shall not publish or disclose information related to the Study.
